titleStmt.title: William Kennlinber et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

We the undersigned petitioners & citizens of Boyd County Respectly Salicit The Remitance of the fines agst Doctor Wm Pugh who was fined at the last November term of the Boyd Circuit Court sixty dollars for keeping a tippling House Doctor Wm Pugh is a Drugess in our town, and being under the impression as the Keeper of a Drug Store he ^had^ the lawfull right to sell whisky when parties Repersentts it was for a medical purpose and he did not violate the law willfuly. but only through ingnorance He being an Englishman and not understanding the laws of our state Doctor Pugh is a good citizen and useful man in our community -- and ^we^ pray and ask ^you^ to Release him of this fine aforesaid

Names
James W Riely
W. A. Foster
H M Childs
over
H A Poage
C L. McConnell
Jas T Ford
Asa Bellow
J D Kincaid
L J Ewing
J. Wellman
H. Preston
A P Borclers
Wm Campbell
J N Eastham S.A.C
J. D. Jones
Jasper Bowling
Andrew Scott
James Fanhanes
K. N. Harris

Boyd Cit Ct
vs
Dr Wm Pugh
$60-
Tipling
Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
230th Jany/ 64
